trans-unit.source: A class that serializes a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance to and from Atom 1.0 format.

Use this class to serialize instances of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and to create instances of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> from XML documents that represent Atom1.0 feeds.
If you have derived a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and want to serialize it, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter%601> formatter.
The Atom 1.0 specification allows for fractional seconds to be specified in any of its date constructs.
When serializing and deserializing, the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] implementation ignores the fractional seconds.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> class.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> to serialize.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to specify a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> to instantiate when a syndication feed is read in.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> derived instance to be serialized.
Verifies whether the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> contains a valid Atom 1.0 syndication feed.
This method does not advance the reader to beyond the start element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
A value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> contains a valid Atom 1.0 syndication feed.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref>.

The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance is not automatically associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter> used to create it.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.

The instance derived from <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.

The instance derived from <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets and sets a value that specifies whether to preserve attribute extensions during serialization.
The default value of this property is `true`.
Attribute extensions are XML attributes that are not defined in the Atom 1.0 specification.
This property determines whether to write these attributes during serialization.

Similarly, this property determines whether to preserve unknown attributes inside the `AttributeExtensions` properties in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance when deserializing an Atom1.0 feed.
A value that specifies whether to preserve attribute extensions during serialization.
Gets and sets a value that specifies whether to preserve element extensions during serialization.
The default value of this property is `true`.
Element extensions are XML elements that are not defined in the Atom 1.0 specification.
This property determines whether to write these elements during serialization.

Similarly, this property determines whether to preserve unknown elements inside the `ElementExtensions` properties in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance when deserializing an Atom1.0 feed.
A value that specifies whether to preserve element extensions during serialization.
Reads an Atom 1.0 syndication feed from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
Reads a syndication item from <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> instance using the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.

This method does not add the newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>, because this is done by the caller of the method.
This method provides an extensibility point for classes derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter> to customize how an Atom 1.0 entry is deserialized.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> used to create the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Reads in a collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.

This method does not add the newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instances to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>, because this is done by the caller of the method.
This method provides an extensibility point for classes derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter> to customize how the Atom entries get deserialized.
For instance, derived classes could delay the reading of the Atom entry until the caller accesses the entry.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance to use to create the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances.
A value that specifies whether all of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances have been read from the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> instance.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances.
Gets the syndication version used by the formatter.
[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] supports Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0 syndication versions.
The syndication version used by the formatter.
Writes the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
Override this method to change the way a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is written.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> to write.
The base URI for the feed.
Writes a collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
Override this method to change the way a collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> objects.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instances to write.
The base URI for the feed.

Writes the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
Implements the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.GetSchema"></xref> method.
Override this method to return your own schema.
`Null`.
Implements the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)"></xref> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> used to read the XML document.
Implements the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)"></xref> method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the XML node.
